intro: Bellevalia dubia subsp. typica, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink. It is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflowers. This subspecies is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
